message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.NE 

The paper proposes a method to improve the ability of RNNs to capture long-term dependencies in sequences, which is a common problem in natural language processing (NLP) and computer vision (CV) tasks. The paper evaluates the proposed method on pixel-by-pixel image classification and real document classification benchmarks, which are tasks related to computer vision and natural language processing. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.CL (Computation and Language), and cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). Additionally, the paper uses unsupervised auxiliary loss to improve the performance of RNNs, which is a common technique in artificial intelligence (AI) and neural networks (NE). Therefore, cs.AI and cs.NE are also likely sub-categories.
